change.changenote: Section 1 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

definition.def: means an angling licence issued for a term of not more than 12 months ending March 31;
means one of the classified waters listed under the heading Class I Coastal Waters (anadromous) or Class I Inland Waters (non-anadromous) in Schedule A;
means one of the classified waters listed under the heading Class II Coastal Waters (anadromous) or Class II Inland Waters (non-anadromous) in Schedule A;
means a water or group of waters set out in Column 1 of Schedule A;
means a surcharge assessed for the purposes of section 111 of the Act;
means a period of 12 months beginning on April 1 in each year and ending on March 31 in the following year;
means a plan for managing guiding for fish and angling referred to in section 52 (3) of the Act;

means the waters of Mara Lake and Shuswap Lake including Seymour, Anstey and Salmon arms, Little Shuswap Lake, and that portion of South Thompson River (Little River) between Shuswap Lake and Little Shuswap Lake.

change.changenote: Section 1 definitions of "classified waters angling licence", "guided classified water angler", "guided non resident alien" and "non-guided non resident alien" were added by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.
Section 1 (2) was added by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.
Section 1 (1) definition of "guided non resident alien" BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 163/2015, effective August 4, 2015.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: guided non resident alien means a non resident alien who is a guided classified water angler;

change.changenote: Section 1 (1) definition of "non-guided non resident" was added by BC Reg 163/2015, effective August 4, 2015.
Section 1 (1) definitions of "non-guided non resident" and "non-guided non resident alien" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 79/2018, effective April 16, 2018

bcl:definition.bcl:text: non-guided non resident means a non resident who is not a guided classified water angler, but does not include a non-guided non resident alien;
non-guided non resident alien means a non resident alien who is not a guided classified water angler;

change.changenote: Section 2.001 (1) and (2) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purpose of section 12 (a) (ii) of the Act, in order to angle for white sturgeon in waters open to such angling, a person must be the holder of both

paragraph.paragraphtext: a valid basic angling licence, and
a valid white sturgeon conservation licence,

section.subsandwich: and have paid the applicable fee and conservation surcharges set out in Schedule C.

subsection.subsectiontext: The white sturgeon conservation licence referred to in subsection (1) permits a resident, non-resident or non-resident alien angler, who possesses a valid basic angling licence for the same period, to angle for white sturgeon on an annual, 8-day, or one-day basis, depending on the conservation surcharges paid and the date or dates listed on the licence at the time of purchase, as follows:

change.changenote: Section 2.001 (2) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 79/2018, effective April 16, 2018

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The white sturgeon conservation licence referred to in subsection (1) permits a resident, non resident or non resident alien angler, who possesses a basic angling licence for the same period, to angle for white sturgeon on an annual, 8-day, or one-day basis, depending on the conservation surcharges paid and the date or dates listed on the licence at the time of purchase, as follows:

change.changenote: Section 2.01 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purpose of section 12 (a) (ii) of the Act, a person must be the holder of an angling licence that permits angling in the classified waters listed in Column 1 of Schedule A during the period set out opposite in Column 4.
The classified waters angling licence referred to in subsection (1) permits

paragraph.paragraphtext: a resident to angle on all classified waters, and

a non-resident or a non-resident alien to angle on a classified water if the classified water angled on, and the date or dates angled, which must not exceed 8 consecutive days, are listed on the front of the licence at the time of purchase.

subsection.subsectiontext: A classified waters angling licence may be issued to a resident, a non-resident or a guided non-resident alien who pays the applicable fee and conservation surcharge set out in Schedule C.
A classified waters angling licence may be issued to a non-resident alien who

paragraph.paragraphtext: is not a client of an angling guide who is authorized under the Act to guide on the classified water to be angled on,
has, if a lottery is required by section 2.02 (2), been allotted angler days to angle on the classified water, and
pays the applicable fee and conservation surcharge set out in Schedule C.

subsection.subsectiontext: An angling guide, or an assistant angling guide employed by the angling guide, does not require a classified waters angling licence while guiding a client of the angling guide on classified waters.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a resident, a non-resident or a non-resident alien who angles on the Bella Coola/Atnarko classified waters.

change.changenote: Section 2.01 (6) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 163/2015, effective August 4, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (7), a classified waters angling licence may be issued to a person who pays the applicable fee and conservation surcharge set out in Schedule C.

change.changenote: Section 2.01 (7) and (11) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 163/2015, effective August 4, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a lottery is conducted under section 2.02 (2) in respect of a classified water, a classified waters angling licence may be issued to a non-guided non resident alien in respect of the classified water only if the non-guided non resident alien has been allotted, in the lottery, angler days for the classified water.

For the purposes of subsection (6) and Schedule C, a single classified waters angling licence may be issued for St. Mary River A and St. Mary River B, which may be referred to collectively on the licence as St. Mary River.

change.changenote: Section 2.01 (3) (part), (4) and (8) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 79/2018, effective April 16, 2018

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A classified waters angling licence permits a non resident or a non resident alien to angle only

Despite subsection (3) and subject to subsection (5), a non-guided non resident alien must not angle in a classified water or part of a classified water that is an item in column 1 of Schedule A.1 during the day or days of the week or the period of time specified in column 2 of Schedule A.1 for the water.
A classified waters angling licence issued to a non resident or a non resident alien is invalid if it specifies a period that is longer than 8 consecutive days.

change.changenote: Section 2.02 (1) and (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: On or before January 15 in each year, the director, or a person appointed by the director for the purpose, may, for one or more weeks of the angling season and having regard to the management plan for the classified water, establish the number of angler days that may be reasonably allocated under subsections (2) and (3) to non-guided non-resident aliens.

The director may, for one or more classified waters, determine by means of a lottery the number of angler days to be allocated among non-guided non-resident alien applicants, so arranged that it distributes the angler days among the applicants by chance.

change.changenote: Section 2.02 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 163/2015, effective August 4, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allotment of angler days for classified waters

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On or before January 15 in each year, the director, or a person appointed by the director for the purpose, may, for one or more weeks of the angling season and having regard to the management plan for the classified water, establish the number of angler days that may be reasonably allocated under subsections (2) and (3) to non-guided non resident aliens.

The director may, for one or more classified waters, determine by means of a lottery the number of angler days to be allocated among non-guided non resident alien applicants, so arranged that it distributes the angler days among the applicants by chance.
The director must inform prospective applicants about any lottery to be conducted as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: before the lottery takes place, by means of a press release or other publication, giving

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the time and place of the lottery,
the manner of making an application, and
other relevant information about the conduct of the lottery;
the results of the lottery, and
the names of the officials of the ministry who were present and conducting the lottery.

change.changenote: Section 2.02 (1) and (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 79/2018, effective April 16, 2018

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may establish one or both of the following for a classified water for a calendar year:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the maximum number of classified waters angling licences or angler days to be allocated to non-guided non residents;
the maximum number of classified waters angling licences or angler days to be allocated to non-guided non resident aliens.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Upon setting a maximum number of classified waters angling licences or angler days for non-guided non residents or non-guided non resident aliens under subsection (1), the director must specify whether the licences or days will be allocated by a lottery or a booking system.

change.changenote: Section 2.02 (6) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director may delegate his or her powers and duties under this section to another person.

change.changenote: Section 2.1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 74/2017, effective March 1, 2017.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A duplicate copy of a licence may be issued if the holder of the licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: completes a statement of loss in the form specified by the director, and
pays the fee set out in Schedule C.

change.changenote: Section 3 (3) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: derives part of his or her income from work related to angling.

change.changenote: Section 4 (e) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: angles in any of the following waters while holding a valid sport fishing licence under the Yukon Territory Fishery Regulations (Canada):

change.changenote: Section 5 (h) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: for non-resident aliens, one classified waters angling licence for the Dean River.

change.changenote: Section 5 (h) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 79/2018, effective April 16, 2018

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for non resident aliens, one classified waters angling licence for the Dean River.

change.changenote: Section 6.1 (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: a disabled resident who holds a valid angling licence issued under the Act.

change.changenote: Section 6.1 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 17/2015, effective February 4, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Special conditions of an angling licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: The condition of an angling licence is that the holder not angle on waters listed in Schedule D unless the holder is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 65 years of age or older, or

change.changenote: Section 9 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: An applicant for an angling guide licence or assistant angling guide licence is required to satisfy the regional manager that, with respect to angling in the region where the applicant intends to guide, he or she has a working knowledge of the Act and regulations and the Fisheries Act (Canada) and its regulations.

change.changenote: Section 9 (1) (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: applicable to his or her angling guide business, and

change.changenote: Section 9 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant for an angling guide licence or assistant angling guide licence is required to satisfy the regional manager that, with respect to angling in the region where the applicant intends to guide for fish, he or she has a working knowledge of the Act and regulations and the Fisheries Act (Canada) and its regulations.

change.changenote: Section 11 (1.1) (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: the period for which the angler day quota allocated is 20 years or less.

change.changenote: Section 11 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: For each water specified in Schedule A for which a regional manager is responsible, the regional manager must not allocate

paragraph.paragraphtext: angling guide licences for the licence year in excess of the number set out in column 2 of Schedule A next to that water, or
guided angler days in the period set out in column 4 of Schedule A in excess of the number set out in column 3 of Schedule A next to that water.

change.changenote: Section 11 (5) was added by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.
Section 11.1 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

section.marginalnote: Adjustments to allocated angler day quotas
section.sectiontext: If a number in Column 3 of Schedule A is revised downward so that the existing allocation of guided angler days during the period set out opposite in Column 4 exceeds the maximum allowable in Column 3, the regional manager within whose region the classified water is located must adjust the allocation of guided angler day quotas

paragraph.paragraphtext: by any method agreed upon by the regional manager and all of the affected angling guides, or
by applying the following:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: first, by reducing any unused guided angler day quotas that are part of an existing allocation;
secondly, if needed, by subtracting the remaining excess guided angler days from each guide according to the percentage of angler days each guide retained after the adjustment under subparagraph (i).

change.changenote: Section 11.2 (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fails to use substantially all of his or her angler day quota, without reasonable excuse, or

change.changenote: Section 11.3 (3) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 85/2019, effective April 15, 2019.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 101 (3) of the Act applies to a notice required under subsection (2).

change.changenote: Section 12 (1) (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: for an increase in angler day quota through transfer from another guide: $300.

change.changenote: Section 13 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: The conditions of an angling guide licence are that the holder

paragraph.paragraphtext: Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 72/97, s. 11.]
report to the regional manager on or before the date specified in his licence,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the number of resident, non-resident and non-resident alien angler days guided,
the species, number and location of fish caught by each class of person the holder or the holder's assistant guides have guided for fish, and
the classified waters licence number of each guided angler on a classified water,

paragraph.paragraphtext: not transfer the angler day quota or other rights under the licence to another person without the prior written approval of the regional manager of the region to which the licence applies, or
use substantially all of the holder's angler day quota or have a reasonable excuse for failing to do so.

subsection.subsectiontext: It is a condition of an angling guide licence and of an assistant angling guide licence that the angling guide or assistant angling guide not accompany or assist a non-resident or non-resident alien angling on classified waters unless

paragraph.paragraphtext: the non-resident or non-resident alien is included in the angler day quota of an angling guide, or
the holder of the licence has obtained the prior written approval of the regional manager to so accompany or assist.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a regional manager issues an angling guide licence to an angling guide who has been allocated an angling guide quota for classified waters, the regional manager may attach conditions to the licence in respect of the classified waters that

paragraph.paragraphtext: limit the period of time and the area in which the angling guide may guide,
limit the species for which the angling guide may guide, and
require, in addition to the requirements of subsection (1) (b) (ii), that the angling guide report

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the size and sex of fish caught by persons the angling guide, or his or her assistant angling guides, have guided, and
the name and licence number of each guided angler who has taken fish from the classified waters.

change.changenote: Section 13 (1.1) was added by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.
Section 13 (1) (b) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 74/2017, effective March 1, 2017.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: report to the regional manager on or before the date specified in his licence,

change.changenote: Section 13 (1) (b) (i) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 79/2018, effective April 16, 2018

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of resident, non resident and non resident alien angler days guided for fish,

change.changenote: Section 13 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 79/2018, effective April 16, 2018

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: It is a condition of an angling guide licence and of an assistant angling guide licence that the angling guide or assistant angling guide not accompany or assist a non resident or non resident alien angling on classified waters unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the non resident or non resident alien is included in the angler day quota of an angling guide, or
the holder of the licence has obtained the prior written approval of the regional manager to so accompany or assist.

Section 15 (1) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person also has in his or her lawful possession fresh dressed salmon or trout, as the case may be, that was capable at the time it was caught of providing a quantity of roe exceeding 1 kg.

change.changenote: Section 15 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply to roe a person possesses at his or her private residence or in circumstances to which the laws of the Province do not apply.

change.changenote: Section 19 (a.1) was added by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.
Section 19 (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: being an angling guide or assistant angling guide, to act as a guide for fish for a person on waters if the person being guided does not possess a valid classified waters angling licence for those waters,

change.changenote: Section 19 (l) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 178/2011, effective April 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: to fail to comply with a condition of an angling guide licence or an assistant guide licence specified in section 13 (1) (c) or (2) or under section 13 (3) (a) or (b).

change.changenote: Section 19 (a.2) was added by BC Reg 17/2015, effective February 4, 2015.
Section 19 (e) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 85/2019, effective April 15, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: being an angling guide on classified waters, to fail to submit the report as specified in section 13 (1) (b) within 30 days of notification by registered mail to do so,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: being an angling guide, to guide for fish for a person on waters not specified in his or her angling guide licence,
